definitions.definition: a device that uses electricity, oil or gas to produce light

examples.text: to switch on/turn off a lamp
An oil lamp burned in the darkness.
The study was lit only by a small lamp.
He got into bed and switched off the bedside lamp.
She could see the rain in the light of the street lamps.
There were oil lamps hanging over the veranda.

definitions.definition: an electrical device that produces rays of heat and that is used for medical or scientific purposes

examples.text: The specimen was viewed under an ultraviolet lamp.

wordOrigin: Middle English: via Old French from late Latin lampada, from Latin lampas, lampad- ‘torch’, from Greek.
